action: I want to accurately record my clock-in and clock-out times
reason: To maintain accurate records of working hours and ensure consistency with payroll calculations
acceptance_criteria: Clock-in/out is only executable by authenticated users.
Users can only record attendance data for themselves.
Clocking types consist of 'Clock-in', 'Clock-out', 'Break-start', and 'Break-end'.
Consecutive recording of the same type is prohibited (e.g., Clock-in followed by Clock-in is not allowed).
Clock-out fails if there is no corresponding Clock-in record.
Break-end is only possible if a Break-start record exists.
Server time is used for clocking (client-side time is not trusted).
Clocking data is stored in UTC and converted to local time for display.
Device information (User-Agent) is recorded at the time of clocking.
The IP address is recorded at the time of clocking.
Location information can be recorded if GPS acquisition is enabled.
A warning flag is added to records made from outside authorized areas.
Clocking data is stored in tamper-evident storage for audit logging.
Modifying clocking records is prohibited for general employees and only possible for administrators.
Original data is retained and saved as history upon modification.
Reason input is mandatory for modifications.
A maximum limit for the number of clocking operations per day is configurable.
Rate limiting is applied to the clocking API.
Idempotency control is performed using request IDs to prevent double submissions.
Database saving is processed within a transaction.
Concurrent update conflicts fail due to an optimistic locking mechanism.
A 400 error is returned when invalid parameters are input.
Parameterized queries are used as SQL injection countermeasures.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Communication is conducted exclusively via HTTPS.
Internal system information is not included in the API response.
Attendance events are sent to an asynchronous queue upon successful clocking.
Attendance events are linkable with the payroll system.
Clocking data cannot be deleted; only logical invalidation is allowed.
Employees can view their own clocking history.
Administrators can view the clocking history of all employees.
Target response time for the clocking API is within 300ms.
API versioning is managed.
User-facing messages and internal logs are separated upon clocking failure.
The audit log features a tamper-detection mechanism.
